ygData.subject: RE: Re: What to buy?
ygData.msgSnippet: Don t flame me too - I wear foreman s tunic with Cured Silk Pants, and my tattoo shows perfectly. ... From:	Thom Green [mailto:thom_mg@hotmail.com] Sent:
ygData.messageBody:
Don't flame me too -

I wear foreman's tunic with Cured Silk Pants, and my tattoo shows perfectly.

-----Original Message-----
From: Thom Green [mailto:thom_mg@...]
Sent: Saturday, February 05, 2000 12:05 PM
To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Re: What to buy?

From: "Thom Green" <thom_mg@...>

Hmm, I just remembered stating that I wasn't nessisariliy
going for stats, I
was going for looks. Atleast with my Chest armor. If I
wanted a neet peice
of stat item in my chest area, I would agree, fact is, I
like the way my
monk looks with this. The reason I think it makes me look
like a monk, is
because with that Gi, i am able to show the nice tattoo on
my belly. :)

Shelza, 18th, Karana


>From: Worlord <worlord@...>
>Reply-To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
>To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Re: What to buy?
>Date: Sat, 05 Feb 2000 10:23:27 -0500
>
>Cured silk makes you look like a monk? I would have to
disagree, what
>makes us look like monks are the fact that we look like
newbies. I
>personally much prefer foreman's tunic. Here is a
comparison
>
>Cured Silk Gi
>8ac
>0.1wt
>
>Foreman's Tunic
>10ac
>+3str +3dex
>WEIGHTLESS
>
>you have .1 less weight, 2 more ac, and +3 str. Ok, so it
looks leather
>but who cares. Once you get to 30 you won't wear anything
that looks
>like cured silk. Thats because there is better stuff out
there
>
>--
>
>Hammeron
>Monk of Quellious
>Karana
>
>--
>Worlord
>worlord@...
